page.title: 03The Lancaster Canal
page.content: The Lancaster Canal runs through Slyne-with-Hest on its way North going to Carnforth.It is no longer used for industrial traffic but for pleasure craft.The Lancaster Canal is a very quiet place with many creatures living in and around it.Usually tourists go boating in their barges in Summer. During the Spring ducks and swans have ducklings and cygnets, and children come from many places to feed them.It is a truly relaxing walk to stroll along its banks.In the Lancaster Canal there are lots of different fish like Pike, Roach and many eels, so it is a very good spot for fishing.Also birdwatchers come and study the different species of water bird. Not only do fish and birds survive in the waters but lots of kinds of weed like Canadian and Duckweed which are fairly common in the canal.
